Last evening, a fire broke out at
a scrap yard in
Binh Chanh district, Ho Chi Minh City. The
fire emitted black smoke that covered the entire area,
causing people to
run away in fear.  2
people saw fire rising in the
scrap yard, about 200 m2 wide, located in
the alley on Lien Street, Hamlet 1, Vinh Loc B Commune, Binh
Chanh District. The inside of this dump was full of
flammable materials, so the fire
quickly spread.  The
firefighting and rescue police team of
Binh Chanh district police sent vehicles and
officers and soldiers to the scene to extinguish the fire and
prevent Lang's fire from spreading to surrounding production facilities
and houses until more than 6:00 p.m.  The
fire was under control, but the fire area
had a lot of plastic materials, so smoke was still
emitted. The functional forces continuously sprayed
water inside to prevent the fire from spreading again.  The
fire also broke
power lines, causing many homes to
lose power. The cause and damage from the
incident are being investigated. Last
night, a major incident occurred at a

assets of the

The collision between many vehicles resulted in

i125. This is a substance that can sublimate
